definition: to knock off (at the end of a day's work)/to finish work
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
work/worker/skill/profession/trade/craft/labor
to put in time and energy/to concentrate one's efforts

sentences.english: Underground engineering is frequently threatened by ground water irruption.
sentences.chinese: 地下工程常常面臨突水災害的威脅。

sentences.english: Nowadays, in order to save land, underground projects gradually increase.
sentences.chinese: 現階段，爲了節約土地，地下工程逐漸增多。

sentences.english: Rockburst is a kind of geological catastrophe, which occurs in the underground rock engineering of high in-situ rock stresses areas.
sentences.chinese: 巖爆是高應力岩石地下工程中的地質災害。

sentences.english: All those underground plants that manufacture piratic CDs must be closed down.
sentences.chinese: 所有制造盜版光盤的地下工廠都必須查封。

sentences.english: The construction and underground structure design of bell and drum tower square are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 西安鐘鼓樓廣場及地下工程是西安市重點工程。

sentences.english: In recent years, I do park in the ink area, now in its characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，我園在水墨畫方面下工夫，現已初具特色。

sentences.english: It's impossible to learn a foreign language without working hard at it.
sentences.chinese: 不下工夫就能學會外語是不可能的。

sentences.english: The teacher asked his students to labour at obligatory courses.
sentences.chinese: 老師要求學生在必修課上多下工夫。

sentences.english: This paper introduces a new geological prediction method and system of underground engineering construction.
sentences.chinese: 介紹一種新型的地下工程超前地質預報方法與系統。

sentences.english: Wujing indicated that directs the first movie regarding oneself, he works hard.
sentences.chinese: 吳京表示，對於自己執導的首部電影，他非常下工夫。

sentences.english: Highway tunnel is a category of underground engineering.
sentences.chinese: 公路隧道屬於地下工程的範疇。

sentences.english: Workers will fare badly under this government.
sentences.chinese: 在這個政府的領導下工人們會過得很慘。

sentences.english: Whether the language is leamt quickly or slow-ly, it is hard work.
sentences.chinese: 語言學的快也好慢也好，是要下工夫的。

sentences.english: In any case work does not include time, but power does.
sentences.chinese: 任何情況下工不需要計算時間，但是功率需要。

sentences.english: The police have banned this illegal factory that printed pirated books.
sentences.chinese: 取締了這家印刷盜版圖書的地下工廠。

sentences.english: By midafternoon, it’s clear that more is needed.
sentences.chinese: 到了下午3時左右，顯然還需要多下工夫。

definition: to go to work/to start work
erhua variant of 做活[zuo4 huo2]
work point (measure of work completed in a rural commune in the PRC during the planned economy era)
(dialect) to begin to dawn/to be just getting light
to change workshifts
threshing floor
to record work points 工分[gong1 fen1]
bricklayer/tiler
bricklayer/tiler/mason
mason
to pull up seedlings (for transplanting)
to be really busy/pressing business
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
handicraft/needlework/work
kitchen (dialect)/CL:間|间[jian1]
to sound the night watches (on clappers or gongs, in former times)
